description: An 1870s Zion Chapel on the Malham Road industrial Estate recently renovated into a family home. Guided tours of the Old Chapel will be available throughout the day.

facilities: Family activities during open house festival

factsheet.heading: The Old Chapel
paragraphs: De-consecrated in 1971, the Zion Chapel on Malham Road has since been used for a variety of light industrial and office purposes. Acquired in 2016, the building remained empty until works started in early 2020 to renovate and rejuvenate it into a family home.

Working with Tate & Co (formerly Tate Harmer Architects), plans were drawn up to replace the temporary racking floor system with a proper floor, open the space up as much as possible and add unique reclaimed and re-purposed features such as the balustrade and bar.
With its vast open plan top floor with far reaching views over south east London, The Old Chapel is being lovingly and carefully refurbished and celebrated.
Guided tours of the Old Chapel will be available throughout the day.

factsheet.heading: The Artwork
paragraphs: In its 10th year, Anise Gallery is branching out from Shad Thames to new studios and premises. In this interim period we have worked alongside gallery artist and print maker Kristina Chan and João Villas's print studio Plaintiff Press to bring you 10 prints by 10 Artists. A series of unique limited edition prints from 10 of the artists we have worked with since the gallery started. Only sold through the gallery the prints have been carefully selected, refined and printed to form a bespoke and beautiful collection. The prints will be on early release for Open House only - after which they will be released one by one over the coming weeks.

During the open weekend we will also be joined by some of the artists who will discuss their work, their experiences of working with us at Anise Gallery, (the good the bad and the ugly) and to answer any questions.

name: Anise Gallery / AVR London
